required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of the Safety and Performance of the Miami InnFocus Drainage Implant to Relieve Glaucoma Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of the Safety and Performance of the Miami InnFocus Drainage Implant to Relieve Glaucoma Symptoms

brief_summary.textblock: Assess the safety and performance of the Miami InnFocus Drainage Implant in patients suffering from glaucoma that is inadequately controlled on tolerated medical therapy with intraocular pressure greater than or equal to 18 mm Hg and less than or equal to 40 mm Hg.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in intraocular pressure relative to the pre-operative value

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of eye-related supplemental medical therapy

arm_group.description: Ab externo glaucoma drainage device with no reservoir

intervention.description: Insertion of MIDI Arrow subconjunctivally with a fornix-based incision after pretreatment of scleral surface with 0.4 mg/mL MMC and insertion of MIDI Arrow tube through sclera into anterior chamber of eye

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, age 18 to 85 years, inclusive
- Glaucoma that is inadequately controlled on tolerated medical therapy with intraocular pressure greater than or equal to 18 mm Hg and less than or equal to 40 mm Hg.
- Patient must have signed informed consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unwilling or unable to give informed consent or unable to return for scheduled protocol visits
- Pregnant or nursing women
- No light perception
- Active iris neovascularization or active proliferative retinopathy
- Iridocorneal endothelial syndrome
- Epithelial or fibrous downgrowth
- Aphakia (without pseudophakia)
- Vitreous in anterior chamber for which a vitrectomy is anticipated
- Chronic or recurrent uveitis
- Severe posterior blepharitis
- Unwilling to discontinue contact lens use after surgery
- Previous ophthalmic surgery, excluding uncomplicated phacoemulsification (cataract) surgery or corneal refractive surgery
- Need for glaucoma surgery combined with other ocular procedures other than cataract surgery (i.e., penetrating keratoplasty or retinal surgery) or anticipated need for additional ocular surgery
- Known allergy to Mitomycin C (MMC) drug.

overall_official.affiliation: Laser Center, Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
